macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Global Equities Rally to Record Highs Amid Tech Recovery
items.summary: The MSCI All Country World Index reached a fresh record, up 0.2%, with Asia leading gains at 1.3%. US technology stocks rebounded after recent AI spending concerns, easing pressure on the broader market.

items.title: US Markets Open Mixed; Dow Hits Record Intraday High
items.summary: The Dow Jones rose 0.40% to a new intraday high of 50,309, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq opened flat to slightly negative. The Russell 2000 gained 0.26%.

items.title: Canadian TSX Surges 1.7% on Metals and Tech Strength
items.summary: The S&P/TSX Composite Index jumped 552 points to 33,023, extending two-day gains to 3.2%, driven by strong performance in materials, technology, and financial stocks alongside rising metals prices.

items.title: Spotify Soars 15.5% on Strong Earnings; S&P Global Falls 7%
items.summary: Spotify Technology posted the steepest earnings-driven gain at 15.5%, while S&P Global declined 7% on weak guidance. Coca-Cola fell 2% despite in-line guidance, and Xylem dropped 9% after earnings.

items.title: Major Insurers Report Strong Q4 2025 Results
items.summary: Assurant and AIG both posted excellent fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, signaling strength in the insurance sector and potentially shifting capital return narratives for financial stocks.

items.title: Vizsla Silver Plunges 12% After Employee Deaths in Mexico
items.summary: Vizsla Silver shares fell sharply after the Vancouver-based mining firm confirmed that several employees taken from its project site in Concordia, Mexico, have been found deceased, raising security and operational concerns.

items.title: Air Canada Suspends Cuba Service Due to Fuel Shortage
items.summary: Air Canada shares fell 4.5% following the airline's decision to suspend all service to Cuba due to an ongoing aviation fuel shortage on the island.

items.title: Bitcoin Struggles Below $70,000 Amid Cautious Risk Sentiment
items.summary: Bitcoin dipped below $70,000 and has failed to reclaim that level, reflecting a more cautious risk stance after recent sharp moves. Ethereum is trading near $2,000.

items.title: Key US Economic Data Expected; Fed Rate Path in Focus
items.summary: Traders are positioned for important US economic data including the NFIB Small Business Optimism report and ADP employment change, which could reshape expectations for the Federal Reserve's rate path.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Ethereum Announces Pivotal L1-zkEVM Roadmap and First Breakout Call on February 11
items.summary: Ethereum is preparing a major architectural shift with EIP-8025 introducing optional zero-knowledge proofs for block validation to reduce hardware requirements. The Ethereum Foundation released a 2026 L1-zkEVM roadmap, with the first development coordination call scheduled for February 11 at 3:00 p.m. UTC.

items.title: Bitcoin Surges Past $69,000 USDT Before Dropping Back in Correction
items.summary: Bitcoin briefly crossed $69,000 USDT early on February 11 but dropped to around $69,000 amid a potential 1:1 correction scenario from recent highs near $97,000. Analysts note similarities to prior selloffs, with resistance at $72,000–$73,000 and possible further downside to $49,000.

items.title: South Korea Regulators Investigate Bithumb After $40 Billion Crypto Transfer Error
items.summary: South Korea's financial regulators launched an investigation into cryptocurrency exchange Bithumb after it mistakenly transferred over US$40 billion (S$50 billion) worth of assets.

items.title: Ripple Hosts Global XRP Community Day Event on February 11-12
items.summary: Ripple's XRP Community Day 2026, a global virtual event with live X Spaces sessions, is scheduled for February 11-12, potentially influencing XRP price movements.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Goldman Sachs Tests Autonomous AI Agents for Process Work
items.summary: Goldman Sachs is testing autonomous AI agents to handle accounting, compliance, and other process-heavy work, reflecting enterprise AI adoption shifting toward specific operational problems.

items.title: UC San Diego Develops Advanced AI Training Method for Text and Image Understanding
items.summary: Engineers at UC San Diego created a new training approach that enables smaller AI models to rival larger proprietary models like Gemini and GPT on complex math benchmarks by intelligently curating training data quality.

items.title: Cognitive Computing Market Projected to Reach $285.72 Billion by 2033
items.summary: The global cognitive computing market is experiencing rapid expansion driven by AI, NLP, and machine learning advancements, with natural language processing commanding over 42.5% market share.

items.title: Vidya AI Introduces AI-Based Grading and Learning Assistant for STEM Classrooms
items.summary: Vidya AI launched an AI-powered grading and learning assistant designed to modernize STEM education.

items.title: Scientists Call for Ethics Rules as AI Fuels Animal Communication Research
items.summary: Researchers have proposed a new ethical framework to regulate emerging technologies like AI and machine learning used to decode animal communication.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play Scheduled for February 12, 2026
items.summary: Sony announced a 60-minute PlayStation State of Play livestream on Thursday, February 12 at 2 PM PT / 5 PM ET, featuring reveals, gameplay updates, and announcements including potential updates on Marvel’s Wolverine, Marathon, and more. The event will stream on YouTube and Twitch channels.

items.title: New God of War Game Rumored for State of Play Reveal
items.summary: Industry insider Shinobi602 teased a potential new God of War game reveal at the upcoming PlayStation State of Play, possibly involving Santa Monica Studio's Cory Barlog and a targeted release date. Fans speculate it could be a Metroidvania-style entry in the series.

items.title: Romeo Is A Dead Man Releases Today to Critical Acclaim
items.summary: Suda51's experimental action game Romeo Is A Dead Man launched on February 11, 2026, praised as the weirdest game of the year for its diverse art styles, punk energy, and blend of action and puzzling. The title features graphic violence and mature themes.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
